channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Public health experts wary as Trump administration takes aim at aluminum in vaccines
item.description: The Trump administration is considering removing aluminum from vaccines, a move opposed by most public health experts.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is considering removing aluminum from vaccines, a move opposed by most public health experts.
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: Amid a whooping cough outbreak, Louisiana officials waited to warn the public
item.description: After a whooping cough outbreak killed two infants, Louisiana health officials waited months to officially alert physicians or do public outreach. That's not the typical public health response.
item.content:encoded: After a whooping cough outbreak killed two infants, Louisiana health officials waited months to officially alert physicians or do public outreach. That's not the typical public health response.
item.dc:creator: Rosemary Westwood

item.title: A spider scientist makes the case for why we should love arachnids
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang goes on a nighttime hike in search of spiders, with Lisa Gonzalez of the Natural History Museum of Los Angeles County.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang goes on a nighttime hike in search of spiders, with Lisa Gonzalez of the Natural History Museum of Los Angeles County.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Intagliata

item.title: Israel launches airstrikes on Gaza, threatening Trump's ceasefire
item.description: The order came after the Israeli military said it was fired upon beyond the yellow truce line.
item.content:encoded: The order came after the Israeli military said it was fired upon beyond the yellow truce line.
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: Companies like Amazon are betting they can slow hiring and still maximize profits
item.description: Amazon is laying off 14,000 workers -- about 4 percent of its workforce. This is part of a larger trend by American companies. They're betting that they can grow without growing their workforces.
item.content:encoded: Amazon is laying off 14,000 workers -- about 4 percent of its workforce. This is part of a larger trend by American companies. They're betting that they can grow without growing their workforces.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Ofman

item.title: Trump-Xi meeting comes amid growing tensions over trade between the U.S. and China
item.description: President Trump is set to meet Chinese President Xi Jinping in Korea. Here's what's at stake.
item.content:encoded: President Trump is set to meet Chinese President Xi Jinping in Korea. Here's what's at stake.
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Are ICE agents covering their license plates as well as their faces?
item.description: The Trump administration appears to be relying on unmarked vehicles in immigration enforcement, NPR has learned.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration appears to be relying on unmarked vehicles in immigration enforcement, NPR has learned.
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Exploring the link between Japan's depopulation and gender inequality
item.description: Gender inequality is accelerating young Japanese women's flight from rural areas to the cities, further depressing the country's already low birthrate.
item.content:encoded: Gender inequality is accelerating young Japanese women's flight from rural areas to the cities, further depressing the country's already low birthrate.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: A matchmaking site helps farmers find buyers for their land
item.description: Websites fashioned like online marketplaces match aspiring farmers with land owners who want to pass their property to someone who will be a good steward of their work. It's part of a growing trend.
item.content:encoded: Websites fashioned like online marketplaces match aspiring farmers with land owners who want to pass their property to someone who will be a good steward of their work. It's part of a growing trend.
item.dc:creator: Sophia Saliby

item.title: The Sudanese army's last stronghold in Darfur has fallen to paramilitary forces
item.description: Sudan's army has retreated from the key Darfur city of El Fasher after an 18-month siege amid reports of mass civilian deaths.
item.content:encoded: Sudan's army has retreated from the key Darfur city of El Fasher after an 18-month siege amid reports of mass civilian deaths.
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett
